newsitem.title: UK: Liverpool cotton - Buyers prefer to wait on prices.
newsitem.headline: Liverpool cotton - Buyers prefer to wait on prices.

text.p: Business activity in Europe was somewhat restricted with most buyers preferring to wait for fresh pricing developments before they add significantly to inventories.
But market sources added that latent buying interest was in evidence in Portugal, Belgium and Germany - and sales prospects in Syrian cotton remained at the centre of attention in Italy.
Markets in eastern Europe were mostly featureless although some potential demand for cotton near at hand was noted in Poland. Long staple varieties were neglected. London Newsroom + 44 171 542 7729
